definition: bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam

sentences.english: Besides this, Javert possessed in his eye the feline phosphorescence of night birds.
sentences.chinese: 况且沙威的眼睛有着夜鸟那种象猫一样的磷光。

sentences.english: At this moment , a night bird is leading the poet setting off along ta warm road, warm amniotic fluids .
sentences.chinese: 此刻夜鸟正引领着诗人上路，一条羊水般温暖的路。

sentences.english: The birds of night peck at the first stars, that flash like my soule when I love you.
sentences.chinese: 夜鸟啄食初现的群星，群星闪烁恰似深爱你的魂灵。

definition: to go off like a rocket/to rocket
to scare a bird into flight
to start in surprise/to give a jolt of surprise
to emit a sound/(of birds, insects etc) to chirp, hoot etc/(of a siren, steam whistle etc) to sound
(bird species of China) Eurasian jackdaw (Coloeus monedula)
to cry/to weep aloud/to crow/to hoot
